content.raw:
That works locally when I use git@ instead of git://  Could be that is the issue; if so, one typo cost me a lot of hours.

I'd like try it for real, but just trying to log on would kill 2 hours of my allotted time and even with the allocation up to 20 hours, that is only 10 tries and I have already burned 4, so I am unwilling to burn number 5 just to see if I can log in and get the repo to download.

When I get some more information about how to create a terminal that can access the FC container from the OCU over the VPN connection alone (not using the SSH key), then I will be ready to try again.  At the moment, I still have no clue how to remotely launch a node once the container is up and running.  All I have is the simpleHTTPServer.  I tried every variation I could think of, for example, telnetd, and running an ssh service inside the container, but cannot get a shell up on the OCU that is connected to the FC container without using the ssh key.
content.html:
That works locally when I use git@ instead of git:// Could be that is the issue; if so, one typo cost me a lot of hours.

I'd like try it for real, but just trying to log on would kill 2 hours of my allotted time and even with the allocation up to 20 hours, that is only 10 tries and I have already burned 4, so I am unwilling to burn number 5 just to see if I can log in and get the repo to download.

When I get some more information about how to create a terminal that can access the FC container from the OCU over the VPN connection alone (not using the SSH key), then I will be ready to try again. At the moment, I still have no clue how to remotely launch a node once the container is up and running. All I have is the simpleHTTPServer. I tried every variation I could think of, for example, telnetd, and running an ssh service inside the container, but cannot get a shell up on the OCU that is connected to the FC container without using the ssh key.
